hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer

Class AbstractRayTracerProducer

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.AbstractRayTracerProducer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.IRayTracerProducer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParallelRayTracerProducer, SequentialRayTracerProducer

    public abstract class AbstractRayTracerProducer
extends Object
implements hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.IRayTracerProducer
    AbstractRayTracerProducer implements IRayTracerProducer interface and specifies object which are capable to create scene snapshots by using ray-tracing technique. This abstract class offers implemented method for producing such scenes, other objects extending this class has to implement only calculateRGB(parameters) method used for color calculations.
    Author:
    Domagoj

      • calculateRGB

        protected abstract void calculateRGB(short[] red,
                                     short[] green,
                                     short[] blue,
                                     hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D eye,
                                     hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D xAxis,
                                     hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D yAxis,
                                     hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D screenCorner,
                                     hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Scene scene,
                                     double horizontal,
                                     double vertical,
                                     int width,
                                     int height)
        Method which accepts arrays which represents intensity of red, blue and green color and calculates values for every pixel defined with other parameters.
        Parameters:
        red - Array of red intensities
        green - Array of green intensities
        blue - Array of blue intensities
        eye - Eye position vector
        xAxis - X axis vector
        yAxis - Y axis vector
        screenCorner - Screen corner defined by user view
        scene - Predefined scene
        horizontal - Horizontal width of observed space
        vertical - Vertical height of observed space
        width - Screen width
        height - Screen height

      • calculateRGBFromTo

        protected void calculateRGBFromTo(short[] red,
                                  short[] green,
                                  short[] blue,
                                  hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D eye,
                                  hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D xAxis,
                                  hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D yAxis,
                                  hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D screenCorner,
                                  hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Scene scene,
                                  double horizontal,
                                  double vertical,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  int yMin,
                                  int yMax)
        Method which accepts arrays which represents intensity of red, blue and green color and calculates values for every pixel defined with other parameters. This method fills arrays only from screen height specified with y-minimal, to height specified as y-maximal.
        Parameters:
        red - Array of red intensities
        green - Array of green intensities
        blue - Array of blue intensities
        eye - Eye position vector
        xAxis - X axis vector
        yAxis - Y axis vector
        screenCorner - Screen corner defined by user view
        scene - Predefined scene
        horizontal - Horizontal width of observed space
        vertical - Vertical height of observed space
        width - Screen width
        height - Screen height
        yMin - Start height index for calculation, inclusively
        yMax - End height index for calculation, exclusively
